content.raw:
From segway-users:

When I specify the "--prior-strength" and "--segtransition-weight-scale” options, it throws an exception and produces a zero-byte params/input.master file. Segway runs fine on the same dataset if I do not specify these options. The problem seems independent of the value specified. My full command is:

segway train 'segmentation/output/genomedata/mydataset_mm10.genomedata' 'segmentation/output/segway_param_search/mydataset_0.4000_7/train.mydataset'  --ruler=100 --resolution 10 --num-labels 15 --cluster-opt '-q short -W 3:59 -m blades -R "span[hosts=1]"' --seg-table='segmentation/segtable.txt' --mem-usage='8,16,24,32,48,64,96,144' --minibatch-num-windows=10 --max-train-rounds=50 --prior-strength=0.4 --segtransition-weight-scale=7

Output:
```shell
Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/bin/segway", line 9, in <module>
   load_entry_point('segway==1.3.3.dev0', 'console_scripts', 'segway')()
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/run.py", line 2863, in main
   return runner()

   self.run(*args, **kwargs)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/run.py", line 2632, in run
   self.run_train()

   dst_filenames = self.setup_train()
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/run.py", line 2134, in setup_train
   self.params_dirpath, self.clobber)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/_util.py", line 150, in __call__
   *args, **kwargs)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/_util.py", line 471, in save_template
   save_substituted_resource(filename, resource, mapping)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/_util.py", line 454, in save_substituted_resource
   text = tmpl.substitute(mapping)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/string.py", line 176, in substitute
   return self.pattern.sub(convert, self.template)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/string.py", line 169, in convert
   return '%s' % (val,)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/input_master.py", line 236, in __str__
   return make_spec(self.type_name, self.generate_objects())
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/input_master.py", line 79, in make_spec
   items = list(iterable)
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/input_master.py", line 483, in generate_objects
   dirichlet_table = self.make_dirichlet_table()
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/input_master.py", line 467, in make_dirichlet_table
   probs = self.make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition()
AttributeError: 'DirichletTabParamSpec' object has no attribute ‘make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition'
```
content.html:
From segway-users:

When I specify the "--prior-strength" and "--segtransition-weight-scale” options, it throws an exception and produces a zero-byte params/input.master file. Segway runs fine on the same dataset if I do not specify these options. The problem seems independent of the value specified. My full command is:

segway train 'segmentation/output/genomedata/mydataset_mm10.genomedata' 'segmentation/output/segway_param_search/mydataset_0.4000_7/train.mydataset' --ruler=100 --resolution 10 --num-labels 15 --cluster-opt '-q short -W 3:59 -m blades -R "span[hosts=1]"' --seg-table='segmentation/segtable.txt' --mem-usage='8,16,24,32,48,64,96,144' --minibatch-num-windows=10 --max-train-rounds=50 --prior-strength=0.4 --segtransition-weight-scale=7

Output:

Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/bin/segway", line 9, in <module>

   dirichlet_table = self.make_dirichlet_table()
 File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segway/input_master.py", line 467, in make_dirichlet_table
   probs = self.make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition()
AttributeError: 'DirichletTabParamSpec' object has no attribute ‘make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition'

content.raw: `--prior-strength` option on it's own seems to be causing the crash on it's own. I can reproduce using this option with simpleseg.
content.html: --prior-strength option on it's own seems to be causing the crash on it's own. I can reproduce using this option with simpleseg.

I found the cause of the error but I'm not certain what the solution is.

In input_master.py:

class InputMasterSaver(Saver):
...
        if self.len_seg_strength > 0:
            dirichlet_spec = DirichletTabParamSpec(self)
        else:
            dirichlet_spec = ""


class DenseCPTParamSpec(TableParamSpec):
...
    def make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition(self):  # noqa


class DirichletTabParamSpec(TableParamSpec):
...
    def make_dirichlet_table(self):
        probs = self.make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition()

Essentially when it tries to create the direlecht_spec, DirichletTabParamSpec doesn't actually have make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition. In fact the only place it is defined is in DenseCPTParamSpec. If the implementation is the same DirichletTabParamSpec may have meant to inherit from DenseCPTParamSpec. Or there is the possibility the wrong method was used here.

@hoffman your feedback would be appreciated here.

content.raw:
I'm guessing that was my error when refactoring this stuff. Originally these were all `segway.run.Runner` methods so `self` initially referred to a `Runner` instance. `DirichletTabParamSpec` shouldn't subclass `DenseCPTParamSpec`, but I think `make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition` should go into `TableParamSpec` which is the parent just for `DenseCPTParamSpec` and `DirichletTabParamSpec`. This means that `TableParamSpec` will also need whatever `copy_attrs` are necessary for that function, so they should be moved from the definition of its child classes up.

Thanks for tracking this down.
content.html:
I'm guessing that was my error when refactoring this stuff. Originally these were all segway.run.Runner methods so self initially referred to a Runner instance. DirichletTabParamSpec shouldn't subclass DenseCPTParamSpec, but I think make_dense_cpt_segCountDown_seg_segTransition should go into TableParamSpec which is the parent just for DenseCPTParamSpec and DirichletTabParamSpec. This means that TableParamSpec will also need whatever copy_attrs are necessary for that function, so they should be moved from the definition of its child classes up.

Thanks for tracking this down.
